record.title: Pantegni pars prima theorica (lib. I-X) - folios ii (left) and iii (right)
record.author: [[:w:en:Trota_of_Salerno|Trotula de Salerno]] (11th/12th century), [[:w:en:Gilbertus_Anglicus|Gilbertus Anglicus]] (ca. 1180-ca. 1250) and [[:w:es:Juan_Gil_de_Zamora|Johannes Egidius Zamorensis]] (ca. 1240-1320)
record.other_fields: {{Information field|name=Dimensions|value=Folio: {{Size|mm|235|128}}}}
record.description: *Lefthand side folio ii; righthand side folio iii from a copy of the [[:w:en:Liber_pantegni|Liber pantegni]] *This is the earliest known copy (prior to 1086) of the [[:w:en:Liber_pantegni|Liber pantegni]], made at Monte Cassino under the supervision of [[:w:en:Constantine_the_African|Constantine the African]] *It is dedicated to [[:w:en:Abbot|Abbot]] [[:w:en:Desiderius,_Abbot_of_Monte_Cassino|Desiderius]] of [[:w:en:Monte Cassino|Monte Cassino]] (1027-1087), before he became [[:w:en:Pope_Victor_III|Pope Victor III]] *Read [https://www.kb.nl/themas/middeleeuwen/liber-pantegni backgroud information in Dutch] and in [https://www.kb.nl/en/themes/medieval-manuscripts/liber-pantegni English]
record.edition: *This manuscript is in large parts a translation from the Arabic of the ''[[:w:en:Kitab al-Malaki|Kitab al-Malaki]]'' (''Royal Book'') of [[:w:en:Ali ibn Abbas al-Magusi|Ali ibn al-Abbas al-Majusi]] (Ali Abbas, died ca. 994) *In the 12th and 13th century various recepies and other medical texts were added to the front (folios Ir-IIv) and back (folios 87v-89r) of the manuscript. Among others, these additions were based on (or also used by) [[:w:en:Trota_of_Salerno|Trotula de Salerno]] (11th/12th century), [[:w:en:Gilbertus_Anglicus|Gilbertus Anglicus]] (ca. 1180-ca. 1250) and [[:w:es:Juan_Gil_de_Zamora|Johannes Egidius Zamorensis]] (ca. 1240-1320)
record.GWToolsettitle: Liber pantegni - KB 73 J 6 - folios ii (left) and iii (right)

record.description: *Lefthand side folio viii; righthand side folio 001r from an 11th century copy of the [[:w:en:Liber_pantegni|Liber pantegni]] *This is the earliest known copy (prior to 1086) of the [[:w:en:Liber_pantegni|Liber pantegni]], made at Monte Cassino under the supervision of [[:w:en:Constantine_the_African|Constantine the African]] *It is dedicated to [[:w:en:Abbot|Abbot]] [[:w:en:Desiderius,_Abbot_of_Monte_Cassino|Desiderius]] of [[:w:en:Monte Cassino|Monte Cassino]] (1027-1087), before he became [[:w:en:Pope_Victor_III|Pope Victor III]] *Folio 1r, middle of left column: ''Cum totius pater scientiae generalitas tres principales partes habeat [...]'' *Read [https://www.kb.nl/themas/middeleeuwen/liber-pantegni backgroud information in Dutch] and in [https://www.kb.nl/en/themes/medieval-manuscripts/liber-pantegni English]
record.edition: This manuscript is in large parts a translation from the Arabic of the ''[[:w:en:Kitab al-Malaki|Kitab al-Malaki]]'' (''Royal Book'') of [[:w:en:Ali ibn Abbas al-Magusi|Ali ibn al-Abbas al-Majusi]] (Ali Abbas, died ca. 994)

record.description: *Lefthand side folio 001v; righthand side folio 002r from an 11th century copy of the [[:w:en:Liber_pantegni|Liber pantegni]]. *This is the earliest known copy (prior to 1086) of the [[:w:en:Liber_pantegni|Liber pantegni]], made at Monte Cassino under the supervision of [[:w:en:Constantine_the_African|Constantine the African]]. *It is dedicated to [[:w:en:Abbot|Abbot]] [[:w:en:Desiderius,_Abbot_of_Monte_Cassino|Desiderius]] of [[:w:en:Monte Cassino|Monte Cassino]] (1027-1087), before he became [[:w:en:Pope_Victor_III|Pope Victor III]]. *Read [https://www.kb.nl/themas/middeleeuwen/liber-pantegni backgroud information in Dutch] and in [https://www.kb.nl/en/themes/medieval-manuscripts/liber-pantegni English].

record.title: Pantegni pars prima theorica (lib. I-X) - folios 008v (left) and 009r (right)
record.author: [[:w:en:Constantine_the_African|Constantine the African]] (ca. 1010-1098/9)
record.description: *Lefthand side folio 008v; righthand side folio 009r from an 11th century copy of the [[:w:en:Liber_pantegni|Liber pantegni]]. *This is the earliest known copy (prior to 1086) of the [[:w:en:Liber_pantegni|Liber pantegni]], made at Monte Cassino under the supervision of [[:w:en:Constantine_the_African|Constantine the African]]. *It is dedicated to [[:w:en:Abbot|Abbot]] [[:w:en:Desiderius,_Abbot_of_Monte_Cassino|Desiderius]] of [[:w:en:Monte Cassino|Monte Cassino]] (1027-1087), before he became [[:w:en:Pope_Victor_III|Pope Victor III]]. *Read [https://www.kb.nl/themas/middeleeuwen/liber-pantegni backgroud information in Dutch] and in [https://www.kb.nl/en/themes/medieval-manuscripts/liber-pantegni English].
record.other_fields: {{Information field|name=Dimensions|value=Folio: {{Size|mm|235|128}}; Text block: {{Size|mm|189|98}}, 2 columns, 62 lines, littera pregothica}}
record.edition: This manuscript is in large parts a translation from the Arabic of the ''[[:w:en:Kitab al-Malaki|Kitab al-Malaki]]'' (''Royal Book'') of [[:w:en:Ali ibn Abbas al-Magusi|Ali ibn al-Abbas al-Majusi]] (Ali Abbas, died ca. 994)
record.GWToolsettitle: Liber pantegni - KB 73 J 6 - folios 008v (left) and 009r (right)

record.description: *Lefthand side folio 014v; righthand side folio 015r from an 11th century copy of the [[:w:en:Liber_pantegni|Liber pantegni]]. *This is the earliest known copy (prior to 1086) of the [[:w:en:Liber_pantegni|Liber pantegni]], made at Monte Cassino under the supervision of [[:w:en:Constantine_the_African|Constantine the African]]. *It is dedicated to [[:w:en:Abbot|Abbot]] [[:w:en:Desiderius,_Abbot_of_Monte_Cassino|Desiderius]] of [[:w:en:Monte Cassino|Monte Cassino]] (1027-1087), before he became [[:w:en:Pope_Victor_III|Pope Victor III]]. *Read [https://www.kb.nl/themas/middeleeuwen/liber-pantegni backgroud information in Dutch] and in [https://www.kb.nl/en/themes/medieval-manuscripts/liber-pantegni English].
record.other_fields: {{Information field|name=Dimensions|value=Folio: {{Size|mm|235|128}}; Text block: {{Size|mm|189|98}}, 2 columns, 62 lines, littera pregothica}}
record.edition: This manuscript is in large parts a translation from the Arabic of the ''[[:w:en:Kitab al-Malaki|Kitab al-Malaki]]'' (''Royal Book'') of [[:w:en:Ali ibn Abbas al-Magusi|Ali ibn al-Abbas al-Majusi]] (Ali Abbas, died ca. 994)
record.GWToolsettitle: Liber pantegni - KB 73 J 6 - folios 014v (left) and 015r (right)

record.title: Pantegni pars prima theorica (lib. I-X) - folios 021v (left) and 022r (right)
record.author: [[:w:en:Constantine_the_African|Constantine the African]] (ca. 1010-1098/9)
record.description: *Lefthand side folio 021v; righthand side folio 022r from an 11th century copy of the [[:w:en:Liber_pantegni|Liber pantegni]]. *This is the earliest known copy (prior to 1086) of the [[:w:en:Liber_pantegni|Liber pantegni]], made at Monte Cassino under the supervision of [[:w:en:Constantine_the_African|Constantine the African]]. *It is dedicated to [[:w:en:Abbot|Abbot]] [[:w:en:Desiderius,_Abbot_of_Monte_Cassino|Desiderius]] of [[:w:en:Monte Cassino|Monte Cassino]] (1027-1087), before he became [[:w:en:Pope_Victor_III|Pope Victor III]]. *Read [https://www.kb.nl/themas/middeleeuwen/liber-pantegni backgroud information in Dutch] and in [https://www.kb.nl/en/themes/medieval-manuscripts/liber-pantegni English].
record.other_fields: {{Information field|name=Dimensions|value=Folio: {{Size|mm|235|128}}; Text block: {{Size|mm|189|98}}, 2 columns, 62 lines, littera pregothica}}
record.edition: This manuscript is in large parts a translation from the Arabic of the ''[[:w:en:Kitab al-Malaki|Kitab al-Malaki]]'' (''Royal Book'') of [[:w:en:Ali ibn Abbas al-Magusi|Ali ibn al-Abbas al-Majusi]] (Ali Abbas, died ca. 994)
record.GWToolsettitle: Liber pantegni - KB 73 J 6 - folios 021v (left) and 022r (right)

record.description: *Lefthand side folio 027v; righthand side folio 028r from an 11th century copy of the [[:w:en:Liber_pantegni|Liber pantegni]]. *This is the earliest known copy (prior to 1086) of the [[:w:en:Liber_pantegni|Liber pantegni]], made at Monte Cassino under the supervision of [[:w:en:Constantine_the_African|Constantine the African]]. *It is dedicated to [[:w:en:Abbot|Abbot]] [[:w:en:Desiderius,_Abbot_of_Monte_Cassino|Desiderius]] of [[:w:en:Monte Cassino|Monte Cassino]] (1027-1087), before he became [[:w:en:Pope_Victor_III|Pope Victor III]]. *Read [https://www.kb.nl/themas/middeleeuwen/liber-pantegni backgroud information in Dutch] and in [https://www.kb.nl/en/themes/medieval-manuscripts/liber-pantegni English].
record.other_fields: {{Information field|name=Dimensions|value=Folio: {{Size|mm|235|128}}; Text block: {{Size|mm|189|98}}, 2 columns, 62 lines, littera pregothica}}
record.edition: This manuscript is in large parts a translation from the Arabic of the ''[[:w:en:Kitab al-Malaki|Kitab al-Malaki]]'' (''Royal Book'') of [[:w:en:Ali ibn Abbas al-Magusi|Ali ibn al-Abbas al-Majusi]] (Ali Abbas, died ca. 994)
record.GWToolsettitle: Liber pantegni - KB 73 J 6 - folios 027v (left) and 028r (right)

record.title: Pantegni pars prima theorica (lib. I-X) - folios 034v (left) and 035r (right)
record.author: [[:w:en:Constantine_the_African|Constantine the African]] (ca. 1010-1098/9)
record.description: *Lefthand side folio 034v; righthand side folio 035r from an 11th century copy of the [[:w:en:Liber_pantegni|Liber pantegni]]. *This is the earliest known copy (prior to 1086) of the [[:w:en:Liber_pantegni|Liber pantegni]], made at Monte Cassino under the supervision of [[:w:en:Constantine_the_African|Constantine the African]]. *It is dedicated to [[:w:en:Abbot|Abbot]] [[:w:en:Desiderius,_Abbot_of_Monte_Cassino|Desiderius]] of [[:w:en:Monte Cassino|Monte Cassino]] (1027-1087), before he became [[:w:en:Pope_Victor_III|Pope Victor III]]. *Read [https://www.kb.nl/themas/middeleeuwen/liber-pantegni backgroud information in Dutch] and in [https://www.kb.nl/en/themes/medieval-manuscripts/liber-pantegni English].
record.other_fields: {{Information field|name=Dimensions|value=Folio: {{Size|mm|235|128}}; Text block: {{Size|mm|189|98}}, 2 columns, 62 lines, littera pregothica}}
record.edition: This manuscript is in large parts a translation from the Arabic of the ''[[:w:en:Kitab al-Malaki|Kitab al-Malaki]]'' (''Royal Book'') of [[:w:en:Ali ibn Abbas al-Magusi|Ali ibn al-Abbas al-Majusi]] (Ali Abbas, died ca. 994)
record.GWToolsettitle: Liber pantegni - KB 73 J 6 - folios 034v (left) and 035r (right)

record.description: *Lefthand side folio 040v; righthand side folio 041r from an 11th century copy of the [[:w:en:Liber_pantegni|Liber pantegni]]. *This is the earliest known copy (prior to 1086) of the [[:w:en:Liber_pantegni|Liber pantegni]], made at Monte Cassino under the supervision of [[:w:en:Constantine_the_African|Constantine the African]]. *It is dedicated to [[:w:en:Abbot|Abbot]] [[:w:en:Desiderius,_Abbot_of_Monte_Cassino|Desiderius]] of [[:w:en:Monte Cassino|Monte Cassino]] (1027-1087), before he became [[:w:en:Pope_Victor_III|Pope Victor III]]. *Read [https://www.kb.nl/themas/middeleeuwen/liber-pantegni backgroud information in Dutch] and in [https://www.kb.nl/en/themes/medieval-manuscripts/liber-pantegni English].
record.other_fields: {{Information field|name=Dimensions|value=Folio: {{Size|mm|235|128}}; Text block: {{Size|mm|189|98}}, 2 columns, 62 lines, littera pregothica}}
record.edition: This manuscript is in large parts a translation from the Arabic of the ''[[:w:en:Kitab al-Malaki|Kitab al-Malaki]]'' (''Royal Book'') of [[:w:en:Ali ibn Abbas al-Magusi|Ali ibn al-Abbas al-Majusi]] (Ali Abbas, died ca. 994)
record.GWToolsettitle: Liber pantegni - KB 73 J 6 - folios 040v (left) and 041r (right)

record.title: Pantegni pars prima theorica (lib. I-X) - folios 047v (left) and 048r (right)
record.author: [[:w:en:Constantine_the_African|Constantine the African]] (ca. 1010-1098/9)
record.description: *Lefthand side folio 047v; righthand side folio 048r from an 11th century copy of the [[:w:en:Liber_pantegni|Liber pantegni]]. *This is the earliest known copy (prior to 1086) of the [[:w:en:Liber_pantegni|Liber pantegni]], made at Monte Cassino under the supervision of [[:w:en:Constantine_the_African|Constantine the African]]. *It is dedicated to [[:w:en:Abbot|Abbot]] [[:w:en:Desiderius,_Abbot_of_Monte_Cassino|Desiderius]] of [[:w:en:Monte Cassino|Monte Cassino]] (1027-1087), before he became [[:w:en:Pope_Victor_III|Pope Victor III]]. *Read [https://www.kb.nl/themas/middeleeuwen/liber-pantegni backgroud information in Dutch] and in [https://www.kb.nl/en/themes/medieval-manuscripts/liber-pantegni English].
record.other_fields: {{Information field|name=Dimensions|value=Folio: {{Size|mm|235|128}}; Text block: {{Size|mm|189|98}}, 2 columns, 62 lines, littera pregothica}}
record.edition: This manuscript is in large parts a translation from the Arabic of the ''[[:w:en:Kitab al-Malaki|Kitab al-Malaki]]'' (''Royal Book'') of [[:w:en:Ali ibn Abbas al-Magusi|Ali ibn al-Abbas al-Majusi]] (Ali Abbas, died ca. 994)
record.GWToolsettitle: Liber pantegni - KB 73 J 6 - folios 047v (left) and 048r (right)

record.description: *Lefthand side folio 053v; righthand side folio 054r from an 11th century copy of the [[:w:en:Liber_pantegni|Liber pantegni]]. *This is the earliest known copy (prior to 1086) of the [[:w:en:Liber_pantegni|Liber pantegni]], made at Monte Cassino under the supervision of [[:w:en:Constantine_the_African|Constantine the African]]. *It is dedicated to [[:w:en:Abbot|Abbot]] [[:w:en:Desiderius,_Abbot_of_Monte_Cassino|Desiderius]] of [[:w:en:Monte Cassino|Monte Cassino]] (1027-1087), before he became [[:w:en:Pope_Victor_III|Pope Victor III]]. *Read [https://www.kb.nl/themas/middeleeuwen/liber-pantegni backgroud information in Dutch] and in [https://www.kb.nl/en/themes/medieval-manuscripts/liber-pantegni English].
record.other_fields: {{Information field|name=Dimensions|value=Folio: {{Size|mm|235|128}}; Text block: {{Size|mm|189|98}}, 2 columns, 62 lines, littera pregothica}}
record.edition: This manuscript is in large parts a translation from the Arabic of the ''[[:w:en:Kitab al-Malaki|Kitab al-Malaki]]'' (''Royal Book'') of [[:w:en:Ali ibn Abbas al-Magusi|Ali ibn al-Abbas al-Majusi]] (Ali Abbas, died ca. 994)
record.GWToolsettitle: Liber pantegni - KB 73 J 6 - folios 053v (left) and 054r (right)

record.title: Pantegni pars prima theorica (lib. I-X) - folios 060v (left) and 061r (right)
record.author: [[:w:en:Constantine_the_African|Constantine the African]] (ca. 1010-1098/9)
record.description: *Lefthand side folio 060v; righthand side folio 061r from an 11th century copy of the [[:w:en:Liber_pantegni|Liber pantegni]]. *This is the earliest known copy (prior to 1086) of the [[:w:en:Liber_pantegni|Liber pantegni]], made at Monte Cassino under the supervision of [[:w:en:Constantine_the_African|Constantine the African]]. *It is dedicated to [[:w:en:Abbot|Abbot]] [[:w:en:Desiderius,_Abbot_of_Monte_Cassino|Desiderius]] of [[:w:en:Monte Cassino|Monte Cassino]] (1027-1087), before he became [[:w:en:Pope_Victor_III|Pope Victor III]]. *Read [https://www.kb.nl/themas/middeleeuwen/liber-pantegni backgroud information in Dutch] and in [https://www.kb.nl/en/themes/medieval-manuscripts/liber-pantegni English].
record.other_fields: {{Information field|name=Dimensions|value=Folio: {{Size|mm|235|128}}; Text block: {{Size|mm|189|98}}, 2 columns, 62 lines, littera pregothica}}
record.edition: This manuscript is in large parts a translation from the Arabic of the ''[[:w:en:Kitab al-Malaki|Kitab al-Malaki]]'' (''Royal Book'') of [[:w:en:Ali ibn Abbas al-Magusi|Ali ibn al-Abbas al-Majusi]] (Ali Abbas, died ca. 994)
record.GWToolsettitle: Liber pantegni - KB 73 J 6 - folios 060v (left) and 061r (right)

record.description: *Lefthand side folio 066v; righthand side folio 067r from an 11th century copy of the [[:w:en:Liber_pantegni|Liber pantegni]]. *This is the earliest known copy (prior to 1086) of the [[:w:en:Liber_pantegni|Liber pantegni]], made at Monte Cassino under the supervision of [[:w:en:Constantine_the_African|Constantine the African]]. *It is dedicated to [[:w:en:Abbot|Abbot]] [[:w:en:Desiderius,_Abbot_of_Monte_Cassino|Desiderius]] of [[:w:en:Monte Cassino|Monte Cassino]] (1027-1087), before he became [[:w:en:Pope_Victor_III|Pope Victor III]]. *Read [https://www.kb.nl/themas/middeleeuwen/liber-pantegni backgroud information in Dutch] and in [https://www.kb.nl/en/themes/medieval-manuscripts/liber-pantegni English].
record.other_fields: {{Information field|name=Dimensions|value=Folio: {{Size|mm|235|128}}; Text block: {{Size|mm|189|98}}, 2 columns, 62 lines, littera pregothica}}
record.edition: This manuscript is in large parts a translation from the Arabic of the ''[[:w:en:Kitab al-Malaki|Kitab al-Malaki]]'' (''Royal Book'') of [[:w:en:Ali ibn Abbas al-Magusi|Ali ibn al-Abbas al-Majusi]] (Ali Abbas, died ca. 994)
record.GWToolsettitle: Liber pantegni - KB 73 J 6 - folios 066v (left) and 067r (right)

record.title: Pantegni pars prima theorica (lib. I-X) - folios 073v (left) and 074r (right)
record.author: [[:w:en:Constantine_the_African|Constantine the African]] (ca. 1010-1098/9)
record.description: *Lefthand side folio 073v; righthand side folio 074r from an 11th century copy of the [[:w:en:Liber_pantegni|Liber pantegni]]. *This is the earliest known copy (prior to 1086) of the [[:w:en:Liber_pantegni|Liber pantegni]], made at Monte Cassino under the supervision of [[:w:en:Constantine_the_African|Constantine the African]]. *It is dedicated to [[:w:en:Abbot|Abbot]] [[:w:en:Desiderius,_Abbot_of_Monte_Cassino|Desiderius]] of [[:w:en:Monte Cassino|Monte Cassino]] (1027-1087), before he became [[:w:en:Pope_Victor_III|Pope Victor III]]. *Read [https://www.kb.nl/themas/middeleeuwen/liber-pantegni backgroud information in Dutch] and in [https://www.kb.nl/en/themes/medieval-manuscripts/liber-pantegni English].
record.other_fields: {{Information field|name=Dimensions|value=Folio: {{Size|mm|235|128}}; Text block: {{Size|mm|189|98}}, 2 columns, 62 lines, littera pregothica}}
record.edition: This manuscript is in large parts a translation from the Arabic of the ''[[:w:en:Kitab al-Malaki|Kitab al-Malaki]]'' (''Royal Book'') of [[:w:en:Ali ibn Abbas al-Magusi|Ali ibn al-Abbas al-Majusi]] (Ali Abbas, died ca. 994)
record.GWToolsettitle: Liber pantegni - KB 73 J 6 - folios 073v (left) and 074r (right)

record.description: *Lefthand side folio 079v; righthand side folio 080r from an 11th century copy of the [[:w:en:Liber_pantegni|Liber pantegni]]. *This is the earliest known copy (prior to 1086) of the [[:w:en:Liber_pantegni|Liber pantegni]], made at Monte Cassino under the supervision of [[:w:en:Constantine_the_African|Constantine the African]]. *It is dedicated to [[:w:en:Abbot|Abbot]] [[:w:en:Desiderius,_Abbot_of_Monte_Cassino|Desiderius]] of [[:w:en:Monte Cassino|Monte Cassino]] (1027-1087), before he became [[:w:en:Pope_Victor_III|Pope Victor III]]. *Read [https://www.kb.nl/themas/middeleeuwen/liber-pantegni backgroud information in Dutch] and in [https://www.kb.nl/en/themes/medieval-manuscripts/liber-pantegni English].
record.other_fields: {{Information field|name=Dimensions|value=Folio: {{Size|mm|235|128}}; Text block: {{Size|mm|189|98}}, 2 columns, 62 lines, littera pregothica}}
record.edition: This manuscript is in large parts a translation from the Arabic of the ''[[:w:en:Kitab al-Malaki|Kitab al-Malaki]]'' (''Royal Book'') of [[:w:en:Ali ibn Abbas al-Magusi|Ali ibn al-Abbas al-Majusi]] (Ali Abbas, died ca. 994)
record.GWToolsettitle: Liber pantegni - KB 73 J 6 - folios 079v (left) and 080r (right)

record.title: Pantegni pars prima theorica (lib. I-X) - folios 086v (left) and 087r (right)
record.author: [[:w:en:Constantine_the_African|Constantine the African]] (ca. 1010-1098/9)
record.description: *Lefthand side folio 086v; righthand side folio 087r from an 11th century copy of the [[:w:en:Liber_pantegni|Liber pantegni]]. *This is the earliest known copy (prior to 1086) of the [[:w:en:Liber_pantegni|Liber pantegni]], made at Monte Cassino under the supervision of [[:w:en:Constantine_the_African|Constantine the African]]. *It is dedicated to [[:w:en:Abbot|Abbot]] [[:w:en:Desiderius,_Abbot_of_Monte_Cassino|Desiderius]] of [[:w:en:Monte Cassino|Monte Cassino]] (1027-1087), before he became [[:w:en:Pope_Victor_III|Pope Victor III]]. *Read [https://www.kb.nl/themas/middeleeuwen/liber-pantegni backgroud information in Dutch] and in [https://www.kb.nl/en/themes/medieval-manuscripts/liber-pantegni English].
record.other_fields: {{Information field|name=Dimensions|value=Folio: {{Size|mm|235|128}}; Text block: {{Size|mm|189|98}}, 2 columns, 62 lines, littera pregothica}}
record.edition: This manuscript is in large parts a translation from the Arabic of the ''[[:w:en:Kitab al-Malaki|Kitab al-Malaki]]'' (''Royal Book'') of [[:w:en:Ali ibn Abbas al-Magusi|Ali ibn al-Abbas al-Majusi]] (Ali Abbas, died ca. 994)
record.GWToolsettitle: Liber pantegni - KB 73 J 6 - folios 086v (left) and 087r (right)

record.title: Pantegni pars prima theorica (lib. I-X) - folios 087v (left) and 088r (right)
record.author: [[:w:en:Trota_of_Salerno|Trotula de Salerno]] (11th/12th century), [[:w:en:Gilbertus_Anglicus|Gilbertus Anglicus]] (ca. 1180-ca. 1250) and [[:w:es:Juan_Gil_de_Zamora|Johannes Egidius Zamorensis]] (ca. 1240-1320)
record.other_fields: {{Information field|name=Dimensions|value=Folio: {{Size|mm|235|128}}}}
record.description: *Lefthand side folio 087v; righthand side folio 088r from a copy of the [[:w:en:Liber_pantegni|Liber pantegni]] *This is the earliest known copy (prior to 1086) of the [[:w:en:Liber_pantegni|Liber pantegni]], made at Monte Cassino under the supervision of [[:w:en:Constantine_the_African|Constantine the African]] *It is dedicated to [[:w:en:Abbot|Abbot]] [[:w:en:Desiderius,_Abbot_of_Monte_Cassino|Desiderius]] of [[:w:en:Monte Cassino|Monte Cassino]] (1027-1087), before he became [[:w:en:Pope_Victor_III|Pope Victor III]] *Folio 87v: ''Explicit prima pars pantegni scilicet theorica. Amen'' *Read [https://www.kb.nl/themas/middeleeuwen/liber-pantegni backgroud information in Dutch] and in [https://www.kb.nl/en/themes/medieval-manuscripts/liber-pantegni English]
record.edition: *This manuscript is in large parts a translation from the Arabic of the ''[[:w:en:Kitab al-Malaki|Kitab al-Malaki]]'' (''Royal Book'') of [[:w:en:Ali ibn Abbas al-Magusi|Ali ibn al-Abbas al-Majusi]] (Ali Abbas, died ca. 994) *In the 12th and 13th century various recepies and other medical texts were added to the front (folios Ir-IIv) and back (folios 87v-89r) of the manuscript. Among others, these additions were based on (or also used by) [[:w:en:Trota_of_Salerno|Trotula de Salerno]] (11th/12th century), [[:w:en:Gilbertus_Anglicus|Gilbertus Anglicus]] (ca. 1180-ca. 1250) and [[:w:es:Juan_Gil_de_Zamora|Johannes Egidius Zamorensis]] (ca. 1240-1320)
record.GWToolsettitle: Liber pantegni - KB 73 J 6 - folios 087v (left) and 088r (right)
